newsitem.title: FRANCE: Polisario says Morocco frees 66 prisoners.
newsitem.headline: Polisario says Morocco frees 66 prisoners.

text.p: The Polisario Front, seeking independence of the Western Sahara from Morocco, said on Thursday the Moroccan government had released 66 prisoners.
"The release of this group of prisoners is an act of humanitarian reciprocity which must not be understood as the end of the conflict," Polisario said in a statement.
The statement, carried by the official Algerian news agency APS, was issued from Polisario's headquarters at Bir Lahlou near the southwestern Algerian town of Tindouf.

Polisario said the release of the prisoners by Morocco came as a "gesture in response to the release of 185 Moroccan prisoners of war last year following mediation by the United States and Argentina".
Polisario Front guerrillas and Moroccan troops fought for control of Western Sahara for more than 17 years until a 1991 U.N. sponsored truce.
A referendum to decide the future of the former Spanish colony was originally scheduled for 1992 but has been stalled by endless arguments over who is eligible to vote.
